question: what is the purpose of the SERIAL ATN OUT signal in the Commodore 64
answer: The Commodore 64 uses this signal to start a command sequence for a device on the serial bus.

question: What happens when the Commodore 64 brings the SERIAL ATN OUT signal LOW
answer: All other devices on the bus start listening for the Commodore 64 to transmit an address.

question: What happens if the device addressed does not respond in a preset period of time
answer: The Commodore 64 will assume that the device addressed is not on the bus, and will return an error in the STATUS WORD.

question: What is the consequence of not responding to the address in the preset period of time
answer: The Commodore 64 will return an error in the STATUS WORD.

question: What is the purpose of the preset period of time in the SERIAL ATN OUT signal
answer: The device addressed must respond in this period of time.
